document.title: The Art and Thrills of Skateboarding
document.description: Dive into the exhilarating world of skateboarding, where fearless individuals defy gravity, push their limits.

body.raw:
## Introduction

Dive into the exhilarating world of skateboarding, where fearless individuals defy gravity, push their limits, and land tricks that are simply jaw-dropping. Skateboarding is a sport that requires a lot of skill, balance, and determination. It’s also one of the most popular sports in the world, with over 11 million people participating in it every year. Skateboarding has been around since the 1950s when surfers started using their surfboards on land instead of water. Since then, skateboarding has evolved into an art form with its own culture and style. In this blog post, we’ll explore what makes skateboarding so special and why you should give it a try!

## What is skateboarding?

Skateboarding is a sport that involves riding on a board with wheels. It’s usually done on concrete or asphalt, but it can also be done on other surfaces like snow and ice. Skateboarding has been around since the 1950s when surfers started using their surfboards on land instead of water. Since then, skateboarding has evolved into an art form with its own culture and style. In this blog post, we’ll explore what makes skateboarding so special and why you should give it a try!

Tony Hawk, a professional skateboarder, once said:

> I feel like skateboarding is as much of a sport as a lifestyle, and an art form, so there's so much that that transcends in terms of music, fashion, and entertainment.

## Why should you try skateboarding?

Skateboarding is a great way to get exercise and have fun. It’s also an excellent form of transportation, especially if you live in the city or suburbs where there are lots of hills. Skateboarding can be done on any surface, so it doesn’t matter if it’s raining or snowing outside! Plus, skateboards are relatively inexpensive compared to other modes of transportation like cars or bikes. If you want to learn more about skateboarding, check out our blog post on how to start skateboarding today!

## How do you start skateboarding?

Skateboarding is a sport that requires a lot of skill, balance, and determination. It’s also one of the most popular sports in the world, with over 11 million people participating in it every year. Skateboarding has been around since the 1950s when surfers started using their surfboards on land instead of water. Since then, skateboarding has evolved into an art form with its own culture and style. In this blog post, we’ll explore what makes skateboarding so special and why you should give it a try!

## What are the benefits of skateboarding?

Skateboarding can be a great way to get exercise and have fun. Some of the benefits include:

- It’s a great way to get exercise and have fun
- It can be done on any surface, so it doesn’t matter if it’s raining or snowing outside
- Skateboards are relatively inexpensive compared to other modes of transportation like cars or bikes
- You’ll learn new skills that will help you in other areas of your life
- You’ll meet new people who share the same interests as you do
- It's good for your mental health because it releases endorphins which make you feel happy

## Conclusion

In conclusion, skateboarding is one of the most popular sports in the world. It’s a great way to get exercise and have fun with friends. Skateboarding can be done on any surface, so it doesn’t matter if it’s raining or snowing outside. Skateboards are relatively inexpensive compared to other modes of transportation like cars or bikes. If you want to learn more about skateboarding, check out our blog post on how to start skateboarding today!

## References

- [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skateboarding](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skateboarding)
- [https://www.brainyquote.com/authors/tony-hawk-quotes](https://www.brainyquote.com/authors/tony-hawk-quotes)

document.title: docker full guide 2023
document.description: Docker provides the ability to package and run an application in a loosely isolated environment called a container

body.raw:
## Docker overview

Docker is an open platform for developing, shipping, and running applications. Docker enables you to separate your applications from your infrastructure so you can deliver software quickly. With Docker, you can manage your infrastructure in the same ways you manage your applications. By taking advantage of Docker's methodologies for shipping, testing, and deploying code, you can significantly reduce the delay between writing code and running it in production.
## The Docker platform

Docker provides the ability to package and run an application in a loosely isolated environment called a container. The isolation and security lets you to run many containers simultaneously on a given host. Containers are lightweight and contain everything needed to run the application, so you don't need to rely on what's installed on the host. You can share containers while you work, and be sure that everyone you share with gets the same container that works in the same way.

Docker provides tooling and a platform to manage the lifecycle of your containers:

Develop your application and its supporting components using containers.
The container becomes the unit for distributing and testing your application.
When you're ready, deploy your application into your production environment, as a container or an orchestrated service. This works the same whether your production environment is a local data center, a cloud provider, or a hybrid of the two.
## What can I use Docker for?


# Fast, consistent delivery of your applications
Docker streamlines the development lifecycle by allowing developers to work in standardized environments using local containers which provide your applications and services. Containers are great for continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) workflows.

Consider the following example scenario:

Your developers write code locally and share their work with their colleagues using Docker containers.
They use Docker to push their applications into a test environment and run automated and manual tests.
When developers find bugs, they can fix them in the development environment and redeploy them to the test environment for testing and validation.
When testing is complete, getting the fix to the customer is as simple as pushing the updated image to the production environment.
# Responsive deployment and scaling
Docker's container-based platform allows for highly portable workloads. Docker containers can run on a developer's local laptop, on physical or virtual machines in a data center, on cloud providers, or in a mixture of environments.

Docker's portability and lightweight nature also make it easy to dynamically manage workloads, scaling up or tearing down applications and services as business needs dictate, in near real time.

# Running more workloads on the same hardware
Docker is lightweight and fast. It provides a viable, cost-effective alternative to hypervisor-based virtual machines, so you can use more of your server capacity to achieve your business goals. Docker is perfect for high density environments and for small and medium deployments where you need to do more with fewer resources.


## Conclusion

Docker is written in the Go programming language and takes advantage of several features of the Linux kernel to deliver its functionality. Docker uses a technology called namespaces to provide the isolated workspace called the container. When you run a container, Docker creates a set of namespaces for that container.

These namespaces provide a layer of isolation. Each aspect of a container runs in a separate namespace and its access is limited to that namespace.
## Next steps

- [https://docs.docker.com/get-docker](https://docs.docker.com/get-docker)

`,(0,l.jsxDEV)(t.p,{children:"Docker is an open platform for developing, shipping, and running applications. Docker enables you to separate your applications from your infrastructure so you can deliver software quickly. With Docker, you can manage your infrastructure in the same ways you manage your applications. By taking advantage of Docker's methodologies for shipping, testing, and deploying code, you can significantly reduce the delay between writing code and running it in production."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\PC\\form\\content\\blog\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-905a76d0-489d-4be4-8f65-93b627f557b5.mdx",lineNumber:12,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,l.jsxDEV)(t.h2,{id:"the-docker-platform",children:"The Docker platform"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\PC\\form\\content\\blog\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-905a76d0-489d-4be4-8f65-93b627f557b5.mdx",lineNumber:13,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,l.jsxDEV)(t.p,{children:"Docker provides the ability to package and run an application in a loosely isolated environment called a container. The isolation and security lets you to run many containers simultaneously on a given host. Containers are lightweight and contain everything needed to run the application, so you don't need to rely on what's installed on the host. You can share containers while you work, and be sure that everyone you share with gets the same container that works in the same way."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\PC\\form\\content\\blog\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-905a76d0-489d-4be4-8f65-93b627f557b5.mdx",lineNumber:15,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,l.jsxDEV)(t.p,{children:"Docker provides tooling and a platform to manage the lifecycle of your containers:"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\PC\\form\\content\\blog\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-905a76d0-489d-4be4-8f65-93b627f557b5.mdx",lineNumber:17,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,l.jsxDEV)(t.p,{children:`Develop your application and its supporting components using containers.\r
The container becomes the unit for distributing and testing your application.\r
When you're ready, deploy your application into your production environment, as a container or an orchestrated service. This works the same whether your production environment is a local data center, a cloud provider, or a hybrid of the two.`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\PC\\form\\content\\blog\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-905a76d0-489d-4be4-8f65-93b627f557b5.mdx",lineNumber:19,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,l.jsxDEV)(t.h2,{id:"what-can-i-use-docker-for",children:"What can I use Docker for?"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\PC\\form\\content\\blog\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-905a76d0-489d-4be4-8f65-93b627f557b5.mdx",lineNumber:22,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,l.jsxDEV)(t.h1,{id:"fast-consistent-delivery-of-your-applications",children:"Fast, consistent delivery of your applications"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\PC\\form\\content\\blog\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-905a76d0-489d-4be4-8f65-93b627f557b5.mdx",lineNumber:25,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,l.jsxDEV)(t.p,{children:"Docker streamlines the development lifecycle by allowing developers to work in standardized environments using local containers which provide your applications and services. Containers are great for continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) workflows."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\PC\\form\\content\\blog\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-905a76d0-489d-4be4-8f65-93b627f557b5.mdx",lineNumber:26,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,l.jsxDEV)(t.p,{children:"Consider the following example scenario:"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\PC\\form\\content\\blog\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-905a76d0-489d-4be4-8f65-93b627f557b5.mdx",lineNumber:28,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,l.jsxDEV)(t.p,{children:`Your developers write code locally and share their work with their colleagues using Docker containers.\r
They use Docker to push their applications into a test environment and run automated and manual tests.\r
When developers find bugs, they can fix them in the development environment and redeploy them to the test environment for testing and validation.\r
When testing is complete, getting the fix to the customer is as simple as pushing the updated image to the production environment.`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\PC\\form\\content\\blog\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-905a76d0-489d-4be4-8f65-93b627f557b5.mdx",lineNumber:30,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,l.jsxDEV)(t.h1,{id:"responsive-deployment-and-scaling",children:"Responsive deployment and scaling"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\PC\\form\\content\\blog\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-905a76d0-489d-4be4-8f65-93b627f557b5.mdx",lineNumber:34,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,l.jsxDEV)(t.p,{children:"Docker's container-based platform allows for highly portable workloads. Docker containers can run on a developer's local laptop, on physical or virtual machines in a data center, on cloud providers, or in a mixture of environments."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\PC\\form\\content\\blog\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-905a76d0-489d-4be4-8f65-93b627f557b5.mdx",lineNumber:35,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,l.jsxDEV)(t.p,{children:"Docker's portability and lightweight nature also make it easy to dynamically manage workloads, scaling up or tearing down applications and services as business needs dictate, in near real time."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\PC\\form\\content\\blog\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-905a76d0-489d-4be4-8f65-93b627f557b5.mdx",lineNumber:37,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,l.jsxDEV)(t.h1,{id:"running-more-workloads-on-the-same-hardware",children:"Running more workloads on the same hardware"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\PC\\form\\content\\blog\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-905a76d0-489d-4be4-8f65-93b627f557b5.mdx",lineNumber:39,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,l.jsxDEV)(t.p,{children:"Docker is lightweight and fast. It provides a viable, cost-effective alternative to hypervisor-based virtual machines, so you can use more of your server capacity to achieve your business goals. Docker is perfect for high density environments and for small and medium deployments where you need to do more with fewer resources."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\PC\\form\\content\\blog\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-905a76d0-489d-4be4-8f65-93b627f557b5.mdx",lineNumber:40,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,l.jsxDEV)(t.h2,{id:"conclusion",children:"Conclusion"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\PC\\form\\content\\blog\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-905a76d0-489d-4be4-8f65-93b627f557b5.mdx",lineNumber:43,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,l.jsxDEV)(t.p,{children:"Docker is written in the Go programming language and takes advantage of several features of the Linux kernel to deliver its functionality. Docker uses a technology called namespaces to provide the isolated workspace called the container. When you run a container, Docker creates a set of namespaces for that container."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\PC\\form\\content\\blog\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-905a76d0-489d-4be4-8f65-93b627f557b5.mdx",lineNumber:45,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,l.jsxDEV)(t.p,{children:"These namespaces provide a layer of isolation. Each aspect of a container runs in a separate namespace and its access is limited to that namespace."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"C:\\Users\\PC\\form\\content\\blog\\_mdx_bundler_entry_point-905a76d0-489d-4be4-8f65-93b627f557b5.mdx",lineNumber:47,columnNumber:1},this),`
